Understate: The claim may understate the number of times Ronald Reagan raised taxes by only mentioning five years (1982, 1984, 1985, 1986, and 1987). It is possible that there were additional instances of tax increases during his presidency that are not mentioned in the claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks specific evidence or sources to support the assertion that Ronald Reagan raised taxes in the mentioned years. It would benefit from providing more concrete evidence or references to back up the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider or provide alternative explanations for why Ronald Reagan may have raised taxes during those years. It could be useful to explore other factors or circumstances that may have influenced his decision to increase taxes.
